alert.note: Alert for Clay; Randolph; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 12:14AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Randolph, east central Talladega and Clay Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1213 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ephesus to near Mount Cheaha to near Waldo. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roanoke, Lineville, Ashland, Wedowee, Lake Wedowee, Wadley, Waldo, Woodland, Malone, Morrison Cross Roads, Barfield, Fosters Cross Roads, Delta, Crystal Lake, Cleveland Crossroads, Dickert, Newell, R.L. Harris Dam, Tennant and Big Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for east central Alabama.
